discussion.content:
B is the correct one
The Service Mode Robot is best suited to unattended automation scenarios. When a process is executed, the Robot Executor runs with the same rights as the user under which it is registered.
https://docs.uipath.com/robot/standalone/2022.10/user-guide/service

questions.question_text: Which of the following options is true about the types of robot installation?

choices.C: Both the service and the user modes are recommended for creating and testing automations, and running attended automations.
choices.A: Both the service and the user modes are recommended for running unattended automations.
choices.D: The service mode is the recommended option for creating and testing automations, and running attended automations.
choices.B: The service mode is the recommended option for running unattended automations.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Each running process uses its own required version of the dependency.
"Each running process uses its own version of dependencies, even if multiple running processes require a different version of the same dependency. For example, if process A requires dependency v18.4.6 and process B requires dependency v19.4.4, then each process downloads and uses its required version of the dependency."
https://docs.uipath.com/robot/standalone/2023.10/user-guide/background-process-automation

Selected Answer: B
Answer is B.

questions.question_text: How does UiPath handle different dependency versions for multiple running processes that run at the same time?

choices.C: All running processes use the latest version of the dependency available.
choices.D: Running processes use the earliest compatible dependency version.
choices.A: Each running process automatically adapts to the available dependency version.
choices.B: Each running process uses its own required version of the dependency.

questions.question_text: Where is the TransactionNumber incremented in the REFramework?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
I think it’s c

choices.B: In the End Process state in the Finally section of the Try Catch activity.
choices.D: In the RetryCurrentTransaction.xaml workflow and in the SetTransactionStatus.xaml workflow.
choices.C: In the RetryCurrentTransaction.xaml workflow and in the Process.xaml workflow.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Answer is A. Checked it on Studio.

questions.question_text: Which of the following activities in UiPath Studio have the Verify Execution property available?

discussion.content:

Answer is B. Tested in Studio.
